question: You know what I'd really like? Some fruit.

question: Why not?
answer: Stop saying why not! I told you-- it's a rule.

question: So do you always follow the rules?
answer: No-- yeah-- I don't know. We don't have that many rules. In fact, we only have one rule-- DON'T EAT THAT

question: Okay, fine. We won't. Forget I mentioned it. I understand if you're afraid--

question: No, really, it's all right. I just thought you might be curious why we can eat everything else that walks, crawls, swims, flies, or grows in the ground, but not that particular fruit. And I thought you might be the kind of man who's willing to take a chance and start thinking for himself, but I guess I was wrong. She glares defiantly at Zed, then starts to walk away. answer: Okay! Fine! You want to try the Good and Evil fruit, you got it. He rips two ripe fruits from a low-hanging bough and hands her one. They both stare at the fruit.

Zed notices a VILLAGER squatting in the bushes right behind his dwelling. ZED Hey! Squanto! Give me a break, would ya'! You got the whole forest! Why does everyone have to crap right behind my hut?
answer: I think, and I could be wrong, that all the poop makes the ground more fertile, which in turn, gives the leaves in the area a softer feel. It's a vicious circle. Oh notices a very pretty young woman, EEMA, standing near the communal fire with TWO HUNTERS. His heart leaps. OH Hi, Eema! question: which was a big mistake. I see that now. You think it won't be awkward the next morning but-- trust me, you just want to rip your eyeballs out. Listen, if you want to impress Eema, tonight at the feast, do the fertility dance with her, then drag her back to your hut.

question: Up to you. From now on you're completely on your own. You should probably get going now. You better take this knife. He hands him a flint knife with a leather-wrapped handle. SHAMAN And some of the guys got together and they want you to have this bow. He hands him a strong hunter's bow.
answer: I don't want to seem ungrateful or anything, but you wouldn't happen to have any arrows, would you? An arrow zips in and sticks in the post next to his head.

question: You'd better get moving. Zed looks around at his fellow villagers, trying to summon what dignity he has left.

ZED Anyways, I'm going away, not because you're forcing me to-- which you are-- but because I choose to. So I'm out of here, and anyone who wants to join me is welcome. He looks around the circle and sees Maya. She sees Marlak staring at her and averts her eyes. ZED

question: Okay, then tell me this-- who's standing right behind you?
answer: You think I'm going to turn around and look, but I'm not. I'm going to gut you like a pig. He is about to plunge his knife into Zed when suddenly he is struck from behind by a heavy tree branch. He falls heavily, knocked senseless by Oh who is standing over him with the makeshift club. Zed sits up and smiles gratefully at Oh.

question: I guess I'm with you.
answer: Was it my speech?

question: No, the fire. I lost everything.
answer: But the speech was pretty good, right? I mean, even I was moved and I was the one speaking.

question: Can we talk about this later? Oh pulls Zed to his feet, and they sneak off into the deep woods.
answer: This is nice, out here, the two of us. Come on, those hunters are idiots. In an hour they'll forget the whole thing.

question: I don't think they'll forget the fire.
answer: You know what we should do? You and me should kill the biggest boar ever-- just huge!-- and take it back to the village. Just to show them. And we won't let anyone else eat it. They'll have to watch us eat it.

question: If it's that huge how would we carry it back? Yeah, we'll make everyone watch us eat a squirrel. Will you get real? There's no going back! There's, nothing to go back to! It's just ashes.
answer: Oh!

question: What are you doing? Zed makes a minimal gesture with his head. Oh looks up. A COUGAR crouches on a tree limb above them, poised to leap. Oh freezes. They talk like ventriloquists.
answer: Don't move a muscle.

question: Will that work?
answer: I don't know. There's two different opinions on this one. Some say run, some say don't.

question: What are you going to do?

question: Yeah, big favor.
answer: You didn't have to come with me, you know. I didn't ask you to come.

And there's no point coming if you're just gonna keep whining about every little-- cougar that attacks you. You want some or not? You making your own fire?

question: No, arrows. We're going to need them.
answer: You're still coming?

question: Incredible. He takes a step forward, the rock shelf gives way beneath his feet and he falls a great distance, screaming all the way down, bouncing painfully off the big boulders, then a long, tumbling slide over sharp rocks and gravel to the bottom.
answer: Say what you want, but that was no accident. You don't see a pattern here?

question: I see a pattern. Every time something terrible can happen to me, it does.
answer: Yeah, but why? Why'd the cougar go for you and not me? Why did you fall and I didn't? Hard to believe it's all just random. Think about

question: Okay.

answer: (getting painfully to his

question: And his flock was untended in the I fear the worst for Abel. I am sorely vexed.

question: For my sin the ground is cursed. Thorns and thistles does it sprout for us, and we are doomed to toil all the days of our lives. For as the Lord has commanded, by the sweat of your brow shall you get bread to eat until you return to the ground from which you were taken. For dust you are, and to dust shall you return.
answer: Wow. That's kind of a downer isn't it?

question: It's the way of the world.
answer: Boy, I hope not.

question: You are welcome to stay the night and lay with my daughter Lilith. Zed looks at the luscious Lilith, then back at Adam.

question: Yeah, there you go. Oh looks at Seth.
answer: My bed is small but you're welcome to share it. It's the way of my people.

question: which omnipotent force?
answer: What do you mean "which" omnipotent force? How many omnipotent forces could there be?

answer: Work with me-- I'm just speculating here. Let's call this force "God"; and let's say this "God" is controlling everything. Maybe God wanted me to have the knowledge of good and evil.

question: Well, no offense, but it's possible that I was chosen and you all just happened to be there.

question: A chosen doesn't need to be strong. I'm big this way.

answer: It wasn't my very first thought, but I'd be lying if I said it wasn't up there.

question: How are we going to rescue anybody? They're killers!
answer: Shit! He leaps to his feet, looks around desperately, and sees nothing but a vast wasteland in every direction.

question: Now where do we go? Zed sniffs the air, puts his ear to the ground, and tastes the sand.
answer: I have no idea.

question: The men of the city are weak and soft, fat with rich food, intoxicated by strong drink.

question: Abraham, I'm a little worried about the city being destroyed.

question: Fine. They stand there for less than a beat. ZED Okay, you win. Take us to Sodom. Isaac takes a couple of steps to the top of a rise and points off in the distance. I knew it was right around here.
answer: Me and my friends sneak in on the weekends. We hang around, pick up on the babes, drink some wine, get wasted on killer hash--

question: Get help! Tell your father!

question: Brothers!! He embraces them. They look confused and doubtful, but relieved. You know, you guys are lucky that sergeant is a friend of mine. I let him sodomize me once right after I got here and he's been real nice to me ever since. wait a second. Do I detect a tone here?

question: Whoa whoa whoa! Hold a grudge much? That was like a fortnight ago.

question: Give me a break! I was dealing with the death of a close family member and I needed some space. But now I realize that you guys are like my brothers. And it's so rare to find a brother that you love. Right? He embraces them.

question: So is this it? We just walk around?

question: What kind of trouble?

Mostly what we worry about are activist types, rabble rousers, getting people all riled up against the King or the Temple Priests. That's death for sure.

question: Pretty harsh, isn't it?

question: Six sacrifices in the last ten days and still no rain. What do the entrails predict?

question: What does it mean?

question: What does it mean for us?
answer: Well, it could mean either a surprise visit from a former friend or sweetheart-- or that you're going on a long sea voyage! Wouldn't that be fun? Because I'm your brother? Perhaps it's not time for a new High Priest. Aaaahh! He dramatically flings his fingers out at the Prime Minister, as if wielding the power of the Gods. Nothing happens. HIGH PRIEST And let that be a warning to you. Next time, I will hurl a lightning bolt at your face.

question: Hey! You didn't let me finish. As soon as I get in there I'm going to talk to somebody and get you invited, okay? Feels like a hair-down kinda scene, don't you think?

question: Yeah, you look so-- gold. How's it going?
answer: How's it going? I just had my whole body painted by a fat guy with no balls, and believe me, he was very thorough, if you know what I mean. How's it going with you?

question: Not bad. Had a little rub and a scrub, now I'm up for some grub.
answer: That sounds nice-- for you.

question: Hey! You'll never guess who's here- - Maya! She's working here-- and she looks great! But she's kinda mad at me. Oh scans the great hall looking for her and spots Zed's sister Eema, his crush, come into the room carrying a tray of food.
answer: There's Eema! Eema has been beautifully groomed and is now dressed as a household slave. She stops to serve some rowdy OFFICERS who take the opportunity to tease and fondle her. She tries to pull away but Sargon, the general, grabs her arm.

question: I don't know. So much has happened. Sometimes I think-- She walks away. OH I love you.

question: Are those my choices?

question: No, really! I'm just-- rubbing oil on this man. She exits.
answer: Mnum imam. I have an idea. Why don't we go back to my place and see what's under all that paint?

question: They're called the "twin cities."
answer: Looks pretty from up here, but some people think God is going to wipe them out because they're so evil.

question: And what do you think? Am I evil?
answer: I don't really know you. But you don't look evil. Well, yeah. I think you're-- incredible.

question: I have body issues.
answer: No, you're perfect. Your face, your hair-- Your eyes are like the sea.

question: My eyes are brown.
answer: Well, it's kinda dark. I took a shot. I know they're big, though-- and wet-- She pulls him close. ZED Can I ask you one thing? What would a girl like you want with a guy like me?

question: My life is devoted to the service of the Gods and the good of the people. I take nothing for myself. He has a huge gold ring set with precious gems on every finger, and a gold tiara on his head studded with rubies and emeralds.
answer: That's so-- unselfish of you.

question: Yes, it is. It's just so-- lonely. Sometimes i hunger for the touch of another human being.
answer: So where does that hall lead to?

question: Come, I'll show you. He takes Oh's arm and leads him down the hail toward a set of incredibly impressive doors covered with cuneiform writing and arcane religious symbols. HIGH PRIEST Behind those doors is the Holy of Holies-- the earthly domain of the
answer: Wow. So who cleans it?

question: it needs no cleaning.
answer: No, of course not. Kind of makes you wonder though-- the guys who built it, did they just die the minute they finished, or did the Gods give them a second to get out?

question: I assume they finished it, then the Gods descended.
answer: Yeah, that's probably it. So you're saying we can't go in?

question: What are we doing here?
answer: I want you to enter the Holy of Holies.

question: Yes! Finally. Now you're talking! Should I enter it right here or should we go back to your bedroom? Does the Holy of Holies like to be entered from behind or--? The Gods are in there?
answer: So they say, but the only one who ever goes in is the High Priest. They say it's instant death for anyone else to enter.

question: Then why am I going in?
answer: This is what you've been chosen for! To speak to the Gods and plead with them not to destroy the city. Then come back out and tell me what it's like inside.

question: Right-- right. Then again, if the rules say--
answer: Do you always follow the rules?

question: What is it with chicks always wanting guys to break the rules? You-all have this bad boy complex---- She kisses him fiercely on the lips.
answer: Do this for me.

question: I'm going in. He enters the Holy of Holies. A FIGURE darts between the columns and hides in the shadows. A beam of moonlight reveals the mark of Cain on his forehead. Thank you, O-- Merciful ones, for-- not like-- killing me, and letting me receive the, uh, blessing of your holy-- godliness. He exhales and closes his eyes again, waiting for some divine response. Nothing comes. I was just looking for the bathroom.
answer: Seize him! The guards arrest Oh as Cain steps up and takes hold of Zed.

question: I wish I was upside down. Looks fun. Oh won't talk to him. ZED So this is it? We're not friends anymore? After all I've done for you?
answer: What have you done for me? I've been attacked by a cougar, I've fallen down a mountain, I almost had the tip of my thingy cut off, I've been greasing up the High Priest all night, and now I'm hanging upside down in a dungeon. And I have to pee real bad. All because of you. You call yourself a friend? Name one good thing you've done for me.

question: I've helped you come out of your shell.
answer: I really have to pee--

question: We pick him! Cain points at a BIG GUY, heavily muscled, eagerly waving his hand.
answer: Him?

question: No, next to him! He points at a BOY, about nine years old and not very big.
answer: He's just a kid!

question: So? You got something against kids? Zed plays the crowd which starts booing in disapproval. ZED This guy hates kids!
answer: All right! All right! We'll try it. Kid! Grab a rock. The boy picks up a good-size rock. Zed turns to Oh.

question: Good thinking, huh? They turn to face the boy, ready to dodge when he throws. The boy winds up and fires a major league fastball that smacks Oh right on the forehead. The crowd cheers. ZED Holy shit! That kid's got an arm!
answer: Okay, everybody on this side now! On the count of three! One-- two--

question: Okay. We do have our differences-- like about a cup and half of brain tissue-- but that doesn't mean we can't work together. Another GUARD approaches and whacks Marlak with his stick. You know, I'd like to, but I did something to my neck-- I must've slept on it funny-- those dungeon pillows are like rocks-- well, they are rocks-- so I should probably take it easy or I'll be no damn good for work tomorrow. Okay! But I should tell you, this isn't really my area. I'm just on a break from the mud department-- The Guard draws his short sword and raises it over Zed. Okay, okay. I'm going. (to Marlak and How high you guys think we're going with this?
answer: Up to Heaven, I guess. That's how tall they usually build 'em.

question: That's ambitious.
answer: Incredible erection. Zed looks down at his crotch. The tower.

question: Oh, right, the tower. Incredible erection.
answer: See, the Egyptians are working on an entirely different concept. Four sides, slanting walls, pointy top. Exactly.

question: I have to get down there.
answer: All right. Without a moment's hesitation, Marlak grabs him and tosses him off the top of the ziggurat. He screams all the way down.

question: Wow. Who saw that coming? Thanks, Marlak.
answer: Now what? Zed looks around quickly, grabs the end of a long coiled rope attached to a big pulley, and hands Marlak the other end.

question: Hello, Eema.
answer: Oh? He stares at her full red lips and big blue eyes.

question: Eema, you're my woman! You hear me?
answer: Okay.

question: Where will you go now?
answer: Might head down to Egypt. I hear it's a happening kinda place.

question: Are you going alone?
answer: Not necessarily. You want to come?

question: I'll get my things. She gestures off and he sees a small train of camels and horses loaded with a ton of her personal possessions. MAYA The Princess gave me a few gifts when she freed us.
answer: Traveling light, huh? Okay, here we go.

question: That's west.
answer: I knew that. Just wanted to see if you did. Zed grins and they start walking, passing a small herd of sheep and goats, tended by VEILED WOMEN, going in the opposite direction. As THE LAST OF THE SHEPHERD WOMEN passes, we notice something masculine about her build and posture. Zed nods politely to her, but she averts her eyes and turns away from him.
